thread.title: Man dies after sustaining burns in welding accident
thread.title_full: Man dies after sustaining burns in welding accident

title: Man dies after sustaining burns in welding accident
text:
Adams County man dies after welding accident
Advertisement
Adams County man dies after welding accident
According to the Lehigh County Coroner, an Adams County man died following a welding accident on April 3 at around 9:30 a.m. in his garage. Ronald L. Milhimes, 83, of Oxford Township, suffered burn injuries while operating a welding torch that erupted in a flash fire. Milhimes was transported to Lehigh Valley Hospital, but he was pronounced dead on Tuesday, April 8 at 7:50 a.m. According to the coroner, Milhimes died from complications of 25-30 % full-thickness lower extremity burns due to the fire.
OXFORD TOWNSHIP, Pa. â€”
According to the Lehigh County Coroner, an Adams County man died following a welding accident on April 3 at around 9:30 a.m. in his garage.
Ronald L. Milhimes, 83, of Oxford Township, suffered burn injuries while operating a welding torch that erupted in a flash fire.
Advertisement
Milhimes was transported to Lehigh Valley Hospital, but he was pronounced dead on Tuesday, April 8 at 7:50 a.m.
According to the coroner, Milhimes died from complications of 25-30 % full-thickness lower extremity burns due to the fire.
